reviewText: Who would know that everything this movie is talking about in 2003 is in the news right now! Good Movie everyone should watch it. Even though it says fiction, it is not! By the way also a good love story!
cannot give 0 stars. so giving 1 star. hopeless movie

Typical bollywood movie with an international spy thriller take - has some good moments, and some poor ones.  Sunny looks way too rotund and chunky to be a kick-ass agent.  His stoic performance borders on being expressionless.  The only solid performances come from the two actresses, Preity and Priyanka, especially Preity, who saves the movie from turning into a total bore.  Amrish Puri delivers a credible villain, but there is a fair amount of overacting by him and many others.  Some of the story line makes no sense, and the movie is about an hour too long.  I did not find the protagonist particularly heroic - he seems to be very comfortable using the women around him to his advantage, at grave danger to themselves.  Its not bad - but could have been much better.
real boring.... very slow.... sunny was not good at all.
Movie is amazing and the quality too.
Entertaining to see the Indian version of some world events.
Entertaining, with lots of action. A little childish at times, though. I did like the plot about fighting extremism vs. assigning blame to a whole country or general group.
It's good to watch once only
Very silly and lead actor not credible

I am a fan of Sunny Deol. While this is not one of his best, it is a good movie because of the interplay between Deol and Preity.  The plot is uneven; good in some places, lacking in others. Nevertheless, it is worth watching.
This movie was great. My wife loved it.
Loved it, so glad it had subtitles I've watched this movie over 100 times
I liked it but a little contrived not that other bollywood movies don't involve some suspension of disbelief  I love Kahn and the actress but it took a little time to get into this movie.
A good try at trying to be more like a Hollywood flick.
